I have only ever been here with my girlfriend and her sister, they happen to be experts in here, and the last time we went, I had grilled duck with tamarind sauce, chicken wings, spicy mixed seafood and the coconut prawn curry, then finish off with a honey and ginger tea, well, I wouldnt have ordered that to finish off, but it did come with a buiscuit!! and it was a great way to digest.It is a great place to go after work with the work mates or friends, the service is attentive, but you sometimes dine in a shared dining room and table, which can get awkward in a private conversation, but the plus is you get to meet people. The only downside to this restaurant is that you can't book, so if you do go, prepare for a queue that moves swifly, and prepare for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom

RmVOJgtu_DSkn7i4RhJXJA.text: This is a chain Thai restaurant that has lots to offer. Especially when it comes to flavours. It also has great atmosphere even though you might be sharing a table with other earthlings as this restaurant has communal tables. On the night when we came it wasn't as busy so we had our own table.

FbPr8BxdpUvTjHByu6dfiA.text: Clean, quick service, and don't be intimated by the long line outside!  It moves pretty quickly.Good ambiance... you're seated at a large, squared family style table.  Do order the Thai calamari and ginger tea with citrus fruit.

uYm5YGBrz2303BUxZnXASw.text: Calamari was amazing. And the salmon was delicious. Will definitely go back to try more.

PtfN2zNupq8wq3oXodQqmw.text: Not sure what all the hype about this place is. The food is decent fusion food, but the service is horrendous! We ordered:Calimari : GoodJungle Curry : Extremely spicy and tasted of burnt currySpring Rolls : These are little fried egg rolls that you can buy at the market and not the cold rolled spring rollsLemon Green ice tea : The highlight of the mealWe were charged for extra lemonade that we never ordered and never got an apology for that from our server. Also one of the waitresses spilled a drink on this poor guy at the next table. It soiled his nice suit jacket and never once did they apologize to the guy either.

r_KvLexcHFMRTRRffuQhLA.text: One word. Calamari. Get it. Whatever else you get is great, but you absolutely, positively, must order the calamari appetizer. Do it.

qaSUtOpCTxLupUtxQeVVfQ.text: Really great place, great food in a cosy atmosphere (you get seated around big tables with unknown people).You have to wait outside, in the cold, for a log time though before they get you seats.I had the Mussaman Duck Curry, which is maybe the best curry I've ever had !Nice deco, toilet doors signs, and shared sink between guys and girls are perfect for eavesdropping on girly chats ;-)Have a nice meal there !

5Tya9nf7kMHLoLZt1Sfqbg.text: I rarely eat Thai anymore and I don't go out of my way to find a Thai restaurant, however Busaba Eathai was recommended to me twice before our trip. We happened to run into it after record shopping and it wasn't crowded. Judging by the other reviews for this place, that was fortuitous. Service was very cordial and prompt. There are low slung square community tables throughout the restaurant, so this isn't a place for a private, intimate conversation. Food was excellent. We had a green curry chicken which was traditional curry with a different variety of veggies which was a nice surprise. The spring rolls were small, almost lumpia-esque. Very good, and the pad thai was very flavorful and the noodles were cooked perfectly al-dente. Following our meal we had a pot of lemongrass tea served in demitasse cups with a small silver pot of honey and some buttery shortbread biscuits. It definitely lived up to the recommendations and was a great way to end an afternoon in Soho.P.S. Check out the loo downstairs, it's quite nice.  I don't know if it was because I drank too much, but I could not figure out the symbols on the doors and I almost walked into the men's room.  The sinks between the bathrooms connect (like the Standard in DTLA), so if you're cheeky you can stick your hand through to the other side.  Not that I did that or anything...

Q8dgGPP0Vi6A7fVHJ5QKNg.text: Stumbled on this place a few weeks ago after a movie with the boyfriend. By the time we came out of the cinema it was quite late and most places (unbelievably!) in Soho weren't taking any more customers but they let us come in at 11pm for our meal which we thought was pretty decent! The food was a little overpriced but a great menu and now they have opened one in Shoreditch I imagine it'll be up there with Wagamama in no time! I recommend the Ginger Beef and the Wing Bean salad if you fancy something light and healthy

YcegSxpiTB512mgDAZGwww.text: We've eating here a number of times, and the food is generally predictably good. Not amazing, but good, and there are definitely standout dishes as well as some disappointing ones.The thai calamari are fantastic, not chewy and spicy and overall tasty. The Som Tam green papaya salad was good, not great and a definitely a little more bland than I have had it before, but overall a good starter.All green curries are to be recommended, I specifically like the chicken one. Paired with coconut or sticky rice it is sweet, spicy and simply good. The Massaman curry and Pad Thai were good, again a little bland with something missing but good enough. The Jungle curry, on the other hand, was NOT good, we were actually rather disappointed. It tasted like burnt barbecue, a little like over-chargrilled meat with an odd aftertaste, I basically only had a couple of bites and the boyfriend finished it (he was too hungry to leave it!)Price - rather high for what you get, and the general atmosphere and hustle out the door once you're done. We ended up leaving over £50 for dinner for two and a couple of beers each, which the food is just not really good enough for.One other great drawback - there are no desserts. None. There are some amazing Thai desserts that go wonderfully after a spicy curry or soup, and there are none on the menu, leaving the experience rather unfinished if, like me, a little sweet bite after dinner is a must.So overall rather good food if you're craving thai, a little overpriced but with some fantastic dishes.

SclhpLlNakcfgUMDQHhcYw.text: FYI I went to the new branch in Old St, which isn't yet on Yelp it seems.Ten years on from my first Busaba experience at the Soho branch this new one felt rather 'meh'. Food was good, i ordered the spicy prawn fried rice, tea and some spring rolls, but nowhere near worth the bill I got for it. The atmosphere and 'ambience' is the same I remember but to me it doesn't justify charging me 13£ for some fried rice and spring rolls that seem defrosted.Better thai joints around and Little Vietnam is around the corner offering better tastes for cheaper!

kCu9xznkP-eZRO4owRjYXw.text: Consistent good food across the chains.  A bit crowded for group dining.

SyJG2xjkjqt9KQfZxn8nZg.text: Yup I like Thai and yes I don't actually mind canteen dining, well as long as those people I'm sharing with don't actually expect me to talk with them. I am British after all!But I'm not a huge all singing all dancing fan that the other yelpers seem to be. I am after all a little spoilt. I have had the pleasure of living in east London for the past few years and the explosion of taste from red and green curry with fresh ingredients is something i come to expect and not something that warrants a song and dance about it. This place is basically the Thai version of Wagamma's, reasonable value hawl you through like cattle venue. I once got taken here on a date and I have to say, if this is your idea of romancing me "It's not you, it's me"...

JSd5CfN1nlokB1tQCc4d4Q.text: Late-night, tasty Thai food in the centre of London. Result.Post-pub kick-out, you'll probably find a long queue outside this Soho restaurant. But don't give up! The canteen-style seating means the line moves quickly, the over-head heating means you'll be comfortable in winter and you get to play with the touch-screen menu while you wait.The food's great (from a statistical survey of 6 meals: the noodles are marginally better than the currys. I've no error bars on that result though) and not too pricey for this 'hood. While you'll likely be sharing a table with strangers, the seating's spaced out enough that you won't have to listen to them chew. Service is speedy, particularly as most people have decided what they want before they've even put a foot in the door. So you might just make that last tube after all...

MiJQ2HJq1_P7gyW8KPE6Hw.text: This place always gets my vote, but on one note the size of the restaurant is smaller than most Busaba's i've eaten at - and i've eaten at a few. The food is TASTY as THAI and the place is always buzzing.

56JMTmuwtoWjvaWs0onPsw.text: Expensive Very expensive for what it is.Especially considering there is s better takeway Thai just around the corner in the alleyway next to Cote!!Be prepared to wait half an hour and groups of 5 or more are unlikely to get a table in that time!

IQIkYu9F5BDchQ4_edZOpQ.text: This was very average, I ordered a pad thai but have tasted better dishes from local thai restaurants at cheaper prices. The dish could have had more spices and less sesame oil!!

uTHSt7Jeo7wc6ZAojhQO5w.text: I have been going to busaba for many years ... I liked their menu, food and service ... However , didn't have a great experience today .. The menu has been changed, not as many choices n not as exciting .. My food tasted rather flat , the chicken in my tom ka soup was fatty n not great taste ... I don't think I will be rushing back to visit ..:( pitty cause I liked this restaurant n love Thai food ..

IucGCprUiu6LUcQihsF1oQ.text: I can't say anything about the food as we did not end up eating in there. This place is a very nice location. It's quite dark inside but it has a ncie atmosphere. However it is really loud and there are shared tables. You have to queue to get in as well. Normally I wouldn't mind if it's not the most intimate place but as the table is very big and it was the six of us it was hardly possible to talk to my friends at the other end without shouting. We ended up leaving the place. I might come back on another occasion to try the food. Nothing for bigger groups though!

JQ4EMw9hgIu14k7Z__5mLg.text: Nice room, a little tight packed.Windows blacked out at the moment, I think for building work.We ate there as a couple. My food was fine, but my girlfriend's chicken was fatty and the coconut rice she ordered turned out to be sticky rice when it came. Staff were lovely about this and didn't charge for the chicken.On the plus side, she did have a lovely and interesting cup of tea. Sadly I can't remember what it was called

aiHGoS8y7GqItLFYG8dMgg.text: This is a great place for an informal meal out, the table are communal and the atmosphere great. The food is Thai and absolutely delicious. The queue can be really big but it is worth joining it. The menu is massive and a lot of dishes are hugely appealing, you could eat here every night and not get fed up. I was in there once when a couple started having a bust up across the communal table, highly entertaining.

Xbrow6EutyLYeDpAeQV4Zg.text: Such a great place - always worth the queue! Love the duck, steak and calamari.

yG4L0niWdz2imNoDftVg2A.text: Perhaps my favourite restaurant in London? Busaba is a great place to grab some informal and really well priced dinner. This branch gets very busy so make sure you are there around 6.30 to get seated quickly. The quality of the place and the food is testament to the queue that lines Wardour St every night. Try the Thai Calamari - my personal favourite.

RfzDLnXR6F7LWyiMzY6MIg.text: Great restaurant, very busy most of the time, often a queue outside as they don't take bookings, but tables move pretty quick. Love the Thai curries and starters. You share tables, relaxed, buzzy atmosphere, reasonably priced.

JjbVsHlRnIZTydOzqDgUbA.text: I really recommend Busaba Eathai restaurant, as good food and friendly atmosphere!

OywvsR-BkbR9aMUrOP6mzw.text: Good, consistent food for a decent price. It's not cheap (about £15 for a meal without drinks). And the queue is usually very long. But it's a decent atmosphere (though you have to put up with communal tables). The staff are pretty nice. The Pad Thai Jay is my favourite dish!

XamGG7UKfCpmx8r5DLLxIA.text: Excellent Thai food, Wagamama style seating, attentive staff.

kA9kOhemcB0L-ZowKWJH4Q.text: This is a stylish and wonderfully lighted restaurant with large lanterns. The food arrives quickly and is also finished as quickly and it's delicious. Dishes are quite exotic and authentic. The pad thai is to die for.

JJwhFN99O0cdkzGT7740jA.text: With a queue snaking out the door and often round the corner any given night of the week, its obvious this place is popular with the Soho media types and rare tourists that stumble this far up Wardour Street. The food is on the expensive side (for Thai), and while the quality and freshness is always brilliant the flavours can be hit or miss. I'd recommend straying far from the typical Phad Thai or Mussaman, and trying some of the more exotic options on the menu. The salads (Thai food? salad? really?) are amazing, and after 20+ visits I can never go past the Ginger and Peppercorn calamari - amazing!

n6qZXuHumL2OtOio3aubnA.text: The food here is amazing and there's always a big queue especially on a Friday and Saturday night, when you will have to queue at least for 20 - 30 minutes to get seated. The food here comes altogether including mains and starters but the food is amazing, a must try is the Calamari.

MLdMB0J3lv3E1vu_RbcZsA.text: One of my favourite places to eat in London, there are three Busabas around I think (one near Selfridges, one in Wardour Street, the other off Tottenham Court Road). A simple menu, that you can't ask for deviations from (means the food comes quicker), the food is consistently good and reasonably priced. I recommend the Thai Calamari - different to Spanish calamari, there's not a battered ring in sight, it's gorgeous. For Wardour Street branch, always allow 20 minutes minimum to queue.

uqqed4GuUj7C0d8PQaRKzg.text: Brilliant restaurant. Everyone I've dragged here have always come out loving it. The selection of unique, tasty Thai dishes served in the buzzing 'canteen style' atmosphere is a good mix. The menu is made up of a range of stir fries, curries, rice dishes and starters. Portions are usually quite generous and an average price for food per person is about £15, all in. Queues outside can be off putting but as other have said, they do move pretty quickly. You can't book in advance unless you're part of a big (12+ group) though they always do their best to accommodate groups. Once inside, service is usually very quick. The toilets, located downstairs, once gave me a fright. I was washing my hands and suddenly someone behind the sink grabbed them! It was a drunk woman in the girls loo!! Basically the male and female toilets have a shared sink bowl separated by a mirror. I think I let out an odd yelp. Embarrassing. One thing to note, they don't do deserts!

fi2jOS9JpL4huvraPSH7iw.text: Fabulous, fresh Thai food in a chic setting. This was my favorite meal in our short visit to London. Found this restaurant in a review on line at London.co and it lived up to its stellar review. A modern and chic spot with shared tables, friendly staff and great service. Walked in for a late lunch without a reservation. The foood was incredibly fresh and delicious. We had vegetarian spring rolls, chicken satay, a spicy chicken curry and other various dihes that we shared and thoroughly enjoyed. The price was moderate for London and I would be happy to go back anytime! Highly recommended.

3eb3F8iUaWKYI592BhhUmA.text: You can always rely on good service and a great meal at Busaba. A diverse Thai menu which includes curries, stir fries, dim sum and the other usual suspects. The food is always piping hot, wellpresented and comes in generous portion sizes. The only downside to this place is that they don't take bookings, so at peak times you often have to queue outside, though it goes down quickly.

WDyvFQb3Dj4rVrQhfohu8A.text: yummy yummyThis place is great. Unless you are unlucky and pick one of the few anomolies on the menu, be prepared for an incredible explosion of fantastic flavours. The Thai Calamari is my favourite.

QE6x5atqIgpt4v0cJjDM_A.text: Busaba: The queues say it allAnyone who visits London knows that everything is really expensive and it is hard to find a decent-priced restaurant. well, Busaba is the answer to your problems_ the food is excellent, sort of fusion Thai, fresh ingredients and chilled out philosophy_ very modern. Everyone sits around shared tables, so if you don't like that, please avoid. You will see a long queue outside the restaurant on most nights_ trust me, that's a sign that the food is good. Be a liitle patient because the queue moves quickly. Top tip: if you are just a couple you will be seated quicker than if there are 4 or more of you in a group. It is a friendly but trendy atmosphere in a trendy part of London. I've been back lots of times and I have never been disappointed. Everyone says it's like Wagamama's but I think it is better than Wags.

mibxjuYArMJ5uF_v7JRHVQ.text: Share the love !I love this place. Fun, casual, and delish! Yet hip as well. There's often a line outside but they turn tables pretty fast. You really can't help but stop by for a meal here when you pass by and see some of the diners eating by the window. It just looks irresistible. It's definitely best if you do family style here and share everything with your friends.

as6yB4er7ONWEmxbrFwfMQ.text: Just fantastic!A real find! If you arrive there and there is a queue, stick it out its worth it! Great food, nice decor. Reasonably priced and something different. One of my favourite places in London!

XaBpezYeMOqGJHRgBHWc6A.text: We stopped in here while roaming Soho for dinner. We got seated almost immediately around 930 and it was still very busy. We had the spring rolls, pad Thai (with crab), duck curry, fried chicken, basil beef and green curry chicken. I have had green curry in a lot of places and this one topped them all by a long shot. Overall the food was fantastic and the service was great. We are a very picky group so always good when we can find reasonably cheap eats that please everyone. Only thing that kinda shocked us was the spice level in the green curry and pad Thai. It was perfect but may be a bit too spicy for some.

BxaIo6FgeR-drLXNmBwosg.text: I really like Busaba. The cafeteria style, bench seating is not always to my liking, and is very "Wagamama", but it is good enough.The ambience, service, food and drinks are all to a decent standard. If you have eaten with me in a place such as this... you know that I always attack any calamari dish with gusto. It is a good test of a restaurant... is the squid stringy? Tough? Rubbery? Well, at Busaba, they can nail it. Bonus!It is not the most regular of places for me to visit but nonetheless, I'm sure I will return here soon.

BuzUIdFAwDDXc2L5AmNA5Q.text: Honestly, if you love Thai food - you should go here. If you don't like Thai food - you should go there as they will change your mind about it (or at least you will dislike a little less!).The service is outstanding - especially given how busy it gets in the evenings. The best time to get there is about 6-6.30pm, as it is not empty already, but it's not yet too full so that you'll be queuing outside.It's best to go there with a few people and order many things - because you would want to try everything once you try at least one dish from there.Their selection of juices with coconut water is amazing - I love mixing up some quirky ingredients!I would strongly recommend this place for seafood lovers - we ordered a melange of seafood, squid and prawns (three dishes) and all three were outstanding and very different in taste! Definitely stay away from rice though - simply, because you would want to keep your belly free for some nicely cooked veggies and proper meat!

KP_ADsqhi8gcr_nlxD_WGw.text: They have decent green curry and tasty tom yam! The seating is really fun- large tables accomidate about 15 people. The sake is also well worth it. You may have to wait a while for a table, but this restraunt is fun time for a night out with good food and a really excellent setup. This being said, London is the curry capital of the western world, and if you are seeking this enigmatic dish, there are much more affordable options with an authentic feel. I would suggest Tayyabs or Needoo Grill.

RdBDZlXqpJlQieE4Nf1SkA.text: Really great thai food. Get the sen chan pad thai, which has real crabmeat on it. I've never had such a thing before, and now hope to have crabmeat on all my pad thai, in perpetuity. I also recommend the honey ginger tea. Our starters of chicken satay, prawns, and some other thing I forget are all worth recommending.This place has a very modern, buzzing, bustling atmosphere. You will sit at a table with another group that speaks a foreign language. It will be fun to people watch.

RGcXN5ZZGNI84p2FGmhLrQ.text: Apparently chinese food is not so hot in London, so Thai was the next best thing.  There's open area window where you can sit and have your lunch/dinner while people watching.  Entering the restaurant, you walk into a warm atmosphere with huge square tables and long seats on each side where you share tables with others.  We walked in pretty late afternoon for lunch so were seated quickly.The service was nice and the food was great.  We ordered the calamari, chili prawn fried rice and the pad kwetio.  Every dish was just the right amount of spicy-ness and seasoning.  Also if you want to order tap water, ask for "tap" or carafe of water -  not just water or they'll bring you the nice bottle that will, of course, be charged to your bill. =POther than that, our stomachs were satisfied overall and ready to start exploring the city! =)   If I come back to London again, I'd definitely seek this place out. =D

6uZodbqNMBc63_Pz8SSgLA.text: Finding decently priced and good food in London is such a challenge (especially when you are thinking in dollars!).  I had heard from friends here that Busaba Eathai was really good so we decided to try it.  It is definitely popular so it's a good idea to get there a bit early since there was a bit of a wait.  It's definitely worth it though!  I had the pad thai which was fantastic!  The atmosphere is nice and this is certainly one of the good ones in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. pad thai

El84dlhtdMfyhXt2vs2Now.text: I came here not expecting much but walked away impressed.II was here with a couple friends and was swiftly seated by the waitress. We were placed at a shared table, but it wasn't a problem for us. In fact, I think many tables in this establishment is shared.The decor and ambiance were nice.... although the place can get a little loud and rowdy.I ordered the Green Curry Fried Rice with Green Curry Chicken. The fried rice and the chicken were both spicy. The curry had the perfect amount of gravy and the chicken was grilled before cooked in curry. My only complaint is the lack of vegetables. The dish literally came with fried rice and the chicken.... Nothing else. The rice was not fried with anything aside from green curry paste.Overall, I thought this place was above average. It wasn't too expensive for the area and the food was above average.... Definitely a place worth visiting again when back in the area.

JxLH3cD4OFeiRgNhWg5WQQ.text: If you love Thai cuisine, you will love love love Busaba. The decor, the incense, the big buddah at the door, the family style seating -- and I haven't even gotten to the food yet!I ordered the Sen Chan Pad Thai -- which comes with crabmeat and mango. It was delicious and perfectly spicy. Best pad thai I have had in a long time and was so surprised to find it in the SoHo of London during my visit there last week. We also shared the Thai Calamari which was awesome! I, of course, took nibbles of my friend's dishes as well and the curry and regular pad thai was excellent. Just really interesting flavor combos, fresh ingredients, and good service too. Overall, delicious food and I actually enjoyed the communal dining, although a bit uncomfortable at first, but it really creates a cool vibe when the food, and most importantly, wine comes out! Also - I think this is a chain or there are multiple locations because I also saw this restaurant at a mall I went to.

szFwBAdH6mC6PaFF4du_xg.text: Loved Busaba!! Their food is beautifully presented and full of flavor. Would definitely recommend the coconut rice and the green curry. Go early because it fills up quickly. Only reason it doesn't get five stars is because you do have to share tables and that can be tough depending who you end up next to.

GwuH0pc9LjrpyxtNAWH_Nw.text: Really delicious thai food! This is where I get my usual thai fix (even though I would prefer the Thai food in Patara) because it is so affordable. If you really love spicy food like I do then I would recommend ordering the Pad Kwetio...you won't be disappointed!

vF-4OJPg9rz8jx5CfyYuQg.text: Great service! Very down to earth and friendly. Very cosy atmosphere. Great value for money. Food was good, but not great.

IEf-I0hKpW_FO4TTzccYvg.text: This place was crowded, if not packed for a Monday night. The staff is good at getting you in and out to accommodate the flow of customers. The selection is nice and the food was good. I really liked the decor. Nice ambiance and almost completely communal tables. We ordered some interesting drinks and delicious food. Maybe not the best place for a group of more than five. Two is perfect, three is fine, four is pushing it. The wait staff was fast getting our orders but never came to collect the check. We sat talking and waiting for more than 15 minutes. Finally we got up to leave to see if someone would take the check. No one cared, so we had to go up to the cashier and then still no one wanted to take the check. We had to ask three times before someone would take the check. Wow.

s_RU4L-VBSAcoGW9Urk0tA.text: Yummy. Amazing red curry/jasmine rice, wonderful smoothie combinations, and reasonably priced. And my friend paid through her app, so we didn't even have to wait around for a bill because of their forward thinking/technology! Excellent!

Rdc2oboF-PedmPxNcvmV4w.text: We disliked this place so much it warranted being my 2nd Yelp review ever, and while I was on vacation no less.With a long line for a table at 10pm on a Thursday, we knew it had to be good... but with an early morning flight tomorrow, in the end we opted for takeaway.Pad thai with no prawns, and chicken satay. Seems easy enough, especially after asking the server to double check our order before leaving.Turned out... our pad thai had prawns (they are so small you wouldn't notice until it was too late)... our chicken satay had the worst sauce, with chunks of peanuts and the taste of flowers. Both were so, so flavorless in comparison to any Thai dish we've ever had.-1 star for getting our order wrong-2 stars for how bland and unsatisfying it tasted-1 star for the service being slow and with attitude=1 star for feeding us, I guessBy far the most unsatisfying meal we've ever had in London. which is most disappointing because of the great reviews it has. I wouldn't go back if you paid me. Be warned!

hKJk_BQ-SsnxZFnXsvHVkw.text: The Thai theme with low lights and chilled atmosphere were nice and table service were promptThe starters were lovely However the portion sizes for the currys were small and you have to order rice as a separate which is disappointing due to the cost of the curry dish alone would have thought it'd include rice.Best to order a noodle dish I ordered a Pad ThaiWhich is a winner ;)

RrUHybUfdHQb6JKbYw0k_A.text: I cannot recommend Busaba enough. I have eaten in a couple of locations and noticed that their menu is slightly different. This one has been my favourite for that. The food is great. The service was good. Overall if you want some thai food in soho then go to Busaba

Fw3vxwtyri5QLWuceSVeMA.text: This place recognizesexactly how to combine spice with flavor. The prawns were very flavorful,the mango had a nice tanginess to it and the crab was wonderfully sweet andbuttery. Their food was excellent. I love to go back here.

WK9dOopzTJA0gJ7t2VA4jQ.text: There are low slung square communitytables throughout the restaurant, so this isn't a place for a private, intimateconversation.This place recognizesexactly how to combine spice with flavor.

PWyd8Xs-WvdGbcZa7mrmhQ.text: I have never been a big fan of Thai food but thought to give this a go. We managed to get seats quite quick sharing a table with a  group that were celebrating a birthday (maybe not the best table to put us next)-STRIKE ONE.I then took the chicken noodles, upon placing the order the waitress who was highly rude and very impersonal as she did not explain how spicy the dishes were, it is common knowledge by now that each restaurant has their own version of what they think is spicy - STRIKE TWO.The final straw was when the dish came out it was covered in oil and hardly any chicken can be found, i ate as much as i could, separating the noodles from the oil base floating at the bottom of the dish- STIKE THREE.This is a restaurant that i shall not be visiting any time soon and i do not recommend it to anyone who prefers more substance to their food.

6dzIEuVf7D3ypoCW3LO_Sw.text: Wow, I think they are onto something here. Great interior design and branding. Food is excellent, not necessarily authentic, but very flavorful and definitely won't disappoint! Tables are all communal, but very tastefully designed that I think a date would still work here even if you are sharing the table with strangers. If I have only 1 complaint, it would be the price but hey, when in London... :)

rfhQANMbZaU8CgyypQu8cg.text: Did somebody say Thai calamari? If you didn't then you should have. I love this place so much. If you're new to London or an oldie it really makes no difference what so ever. It's always going to be a great place to just pop in and have awesome food. If you don't like people don't go because here you share tables and I personal meet the most amazing people - I once had the pleasure of eating with some of the wind section of the French Philharmonic Orchestra. Haha I said wind!Ps. You can't book so if you eating late wear comfortable shoes - yes missy, I'm talking to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Num num num

3qMIg1tn-VQwCMpMCswE8w.text: I hope you like sharing, but this is not a keep a dish to yourself sorta place. Besides, sharing is caring. Right?!Good asian foodGood serviceGood spice/kick to the dishesBombtastic.

U_bdUeysVhwMcE8Q6oPjeA.text: Now this, this is what I call good food!  Hands down the best meal I had in all of London.  The place was elegant, dimly lit, and the service was decent.  But the food, the food was the best surprise of the evening.  This place knows exactly how to merge spice with flavor.  Every bite was to die for and had we not arrived just one hour prior to closing, I may have allowed myself to order one more entree', hell it was my last night in town!  I really wanted to order the Tom Yum to see how it compared against our American offerings, but my friend suggested the Sen chan pad Thai.  I was not disappointed.  The prawns were very flavorful, the mango had a nice tanginess to it and the crab was wonderfully sweet and buttery. I tried my friends Pad see ew and I really really loved it.  The dish had a nice smokiness thanks to the wok fried noodles, but I think it could have used a little more broccoli.  The Mussaman duck curry was another show stopper.  The flavors were rich and decadent, I almost wanted to pick up my friend's bowl and slurp down the curry sauce myself!  I didn't, though, since I was trying to be on my best behavior. My favorite part of the evening was my Guava Bellini.  The fizziness of the champagne combined with the tropical fruit made this quite the special drink.  And being that we were already in Soho, we got to take an interesting stroll through the neighborhood after dinner.  Definitely a must if you're visiting and if you're a local, this place should be a regular dining destination.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Guava Bellini and Sen chan pad Thai
Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Our table

j8Zl96Fbo0vHRZxsMr554Q.text: I typically _hate_ chain restaurants for variety of reasons and this one is one of the exceptions.The first thing you will notice is they always have a queue.  Don't be scurred by it tho 'cause it cycles thru fast.Their food is good and speedy.  They churn out customers like hot cakes!  I had their Pad Kwetio, Calamari, Red Lamb Curry and they are all very tasty.  I recommend them.  Their sticky rice was not sticky enough for me, but it might not be their fault.I had their coconut and raspberry drink, it was interesting, but once is enough for that type of thing.The environment of the restaurant is kinda packed and south Asia like...?  It's all wooden desk and benches and shared among everyone.  Very cozy, crowded, friendly atmosphere.  Very cultural.It's not going to be a romantic dinner here but it definitely will be a tasty one.  One more note, they don't serve desserts, BUT  you  must hold hands and skip over to L'Eto Cafe across the street to top it all off.Definitely will go back.The End.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. calamari
Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Pad kwetio

wIpqqsbxWot9aYkWYzdVZA.text: Plus points for clear gluten-free and vegeterian markings on the menu. Genuinely friendly staff and everything smelled and tasted so good. The interior was beautiful. We shared a table with another company but it was big enough that it still felt private. Tip - try the guava juice!

TE4dE8v9qsqj46Twj4At9w.text: Lovely setting, had a great meal here with a lovely service to match. I'd recommend it. Location is busy even for a week night. I had the grilled chicken with sticky rice and some veggies. Yum!. I'm surprised that it's a chain.

97Z8VfOKnzFdkJi9hCGN3w.text: I have continued to frequent this thai restaurant at multiple locations because everyone I know says its fantastic, the Yelp reviews are great, and it's incredibly convenient for a quick meal. However, every time I come away disappointed. I'm unsure if I keep ordering the wrong thing or I'm just biased by experiences of thai food in Thailand, but for some reason, it just never really hits the spot. That being said, the service is very quick, there are multiple locations, it's always a decent meal, and it's great for big groups. Additionally, the salt and pepper squid starter is actually quite good! I would recommend (and have recommended) this place to people looking for decent thai food before a show or someone who wants something quick and easy, but if you're looking for top-class thai food, I would move on.

EOihD_n9eQusJb_nGdLP0A.text: Love it love it love it.Not sure anyone who is used to sharing table with other people... but they have these large square tables and they sit few parties at the same table as more customers arrive at the restaurant.  I enjoyed the atmosphere very much and the dishes are quite good! Being in soho, you definitely are surrounded by a hipper and beautiful group of people. This is a great spot to stop after all the walks around town especially after the national gallery.

lm3y727QFuU2TlAwADwa4A.text: We visited London last week and doing the usual: walking around all day and waiting until we were starving before really looking for somewhere to eat, resulting in some rumbling tummies and some speedy yelping!We were around the Oxford St. area so decided to head towards Soho. After reading some good reviews we decided on Busaba Eathai.It was quite hard to find this place even though we had looked on a map. The main reason was because the typography is terrible on the signage and barely legible. Secondly because the canopy hangs so low it covers most said signage. Inside was nice though, with dark earthy coloured wood. The staff were really friendly and service was extremely quick. I cannot believe how quick the food came. I ordered the seafood ramen and the boy had spicy prawn rice with roti bread. My ramen was nice but there could have been a bit more favour and I added more spice. The prawns were good but there wasn't much more seafood. The rice was really nice and part of me wishes I had ordered that. The roti was ok, a little bit on the greasy side. We ordered the calamari on recommendation of another yelper and I am glad we did, it was very tasty, though the soy sauce available was very salty (maybe I am used to using my own low salt sauces?)It was good for a quick feed, but not a nice relaxed meal, as everything feels like a huge rush to get you in and out which was a shame, especially as it was only a Wednesday.We enjoyed this restaurant but would be more inclined to try somewhere else next time we're in London.

qkHT4xQJKaech1qXBilokw.text: This place is really good. Little shocked they did not have red or green chicken curry. Every place I have ever been to has this but no worries. We started with chicken sate which was really good. Moved on to ginger beef and it was amazing. Only complaint is that the amount of food is really small. Being an American might give me a bias view. But we had to order two plates of food which made the dinner fairly expensive. It was worth it. We also had the jungle chicken and it wasn't as rich and creamy as I would have hoped, bit watery, but tasted fine. 4 stars because the portions were small and the service was really slow.

3TCjEEBv09ntSBW7YMsfaA.text: Great tasting food which was full of flavours. Busy atmosphere which adds to the experience of London. The tables can seat about 12 people which is cool as you can end up meeting new people. For someone outside London it's quite expensive.

RxH4Ft9rdPPR7p5gFSVtRg.text: Busaba is a solid Thai restaurant with a lot to like. The service is fast and efficient. The food is quite good - I've never been disappointed. There is a nice selection of juices and the place is vegan friendly with designations on the menu. In the past I've had the curry and spicy noodles and it was very nice. Stir fry is quite good with a mix of spice, sweet and smoky flavors. I was a little disappointed in the wings as a side dish. They were deep fried and not spiced at all as far as I could tell - a little strange actually. If you go in the summer, be prepared to wait in line, but its a friendly atmosphere as its just on the really active edge of SOHO. Also, the seating is low and at communal tables - which is kind of cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. The window come out in the summer so you can chat with the people in line.
Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom

h_eoEVPVo745lT8ANyKjzQ.text: Fun, "fusion" type of atmosphere. Low lights, large square communal tables that can be intimate or as social as you desire.We went for a late dinner and lucked out by finding this place. Many restaurants were closed but Busaba was still open and full of life.  We had the pad Thai and pad Thai kwetio (sp?) because we were craving noodles and washed it down with some white wine.Reasonable prices, good service and good food. We were warned the pad kwetio was spicy, but my theory is that the farther north you go the less scared I am of sweating due to food.....and I was right. Not spicy, but still very tasty.We had a great experience and would try this place again in the future.

MjDUKyx_H3MNBu-sznop8A.text: Delicious food but LOUD.  I would give it 5 stars except for the noise level at dinner.  The duck cashew curry was amazing, get it with the coconut rice.   My husband had the laksa which was spicy and flavorful.  Community style seating.  No list, just wait in line.  The line looked long but we waited only 5 minutes for a seat.   I would go again at lunch when hopefully the noise level would be more acceptable.

yI7A56_UO5aSgGjM5IM3Dw.text: Great atmosphere. Quick service and well priced. Food was tasty but not spicy (we asked for spicy dishes) like the waiter warned. Definitely worth visiting but can't give it a 4 when compared to other restaurants. I would come back though!

SxyMlYz1kHMEz2XnQGxWLg.text: A fancy place with just ok food. When you walk in the restaurant, you almost can't find any Asian guests, and I, as an Asian who is very familiar with Thai food,  realized why shortly. Noodle soup is under seasoning - shows no long cook for the soup, Pad Thai has no dry shrimp flavor ( shows that they didn't use appropriate technics), Thai salad was under seasoning with no peanut flavor, and the Thai calamari is way too salty/over seasoning.

fGjdTC9NLtB6dEsrKMIAgQ.text: Came here with my family and friends. Amazing Thai food place! Everything we ordered was just amazing! I personally got the shrimp pad Thai and calamari! Sooooo delish! I would definitely be coming back here when I'm back in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Chinese broccoli, curry, and calamari.
Photo of Busaba Soho - Soho, London, United Kingdom. Shrimp pad Thai with coconut water.

xF0xQ-J9uBo5WktwfcEQoA.text: the calamari. OMG...best I've had. EVER.good service.good ambiance.definetly worth a visit.

hY1zELNPkeFdv5KgFDL0_g.text: This place was very strange. The service was poor - when we (party of 2) arrived, there were several people milling about the front, but no maitre d' stand or anyone taking names. There were also many seats available in the dining room. Eventually someone came by and sat everyone. The tables are large - about 8 or 10 people - and are meant to be shared. Which was fine until the couple to our left was on an incredibly awkward first or second date, and the one member of the group of young women to our right sat way too close to me. Obviously this is not the restaurant's fault, but it was their fault that it took 20 minutes for anyone to come by to take a drink order. By this point, we just ordered our food (2 mains and 1 starter to share) because we anticipated another long wait. Thirty-five minutes later, our starter came out, and we enquired as to the whereabouts of our drinks. About three minutes later, before we had even eaten half of the starter, our main courses appeared. And we asked again about our drinks. A few minutes later, they finally appeared. The food was rather bland; I expect Thai food to be very flavourful. We started out with fish cakes. I had one bite and couldn't eat anymore. The texture just wasn't for me, but my boyfriend "didn't mind" them and had a few. For my main, I had pad thai, which was alright, but I've had better from the frozen section of the grocery store and a little added peanut butter. My boyfriend had a curry dish, which was completely forgettable. Luckily, there was some sriracha on the table, so we were able to spice up the food, but when I go out to eat - especially for Thai - I expect the food to be cooked well enough to not need to add any hot sauce. When we finished, our plates were taken rather quickly, but we had to wait another 30 minutes for our bill. It's worth noting that there were several empty seats in the restaurant, and several employees standing around rather idly. We also didn't have one consistent server, like you would at most establishments, which I found strange. Uniform tops could also stand to be  few inches longer.

_aW5CdTX5m1hNCwGIyrhfw.text: Fantastic and delicious food Thai food in London.  The place was packed and the seating is mostly shared with others.  The food was delicious with proper portions.  I would definitely be back the next time I am in London.  Cheers!

zWOy14ANomFCU2tTwIf8PA.text: Odd that you eat at tables "with other people" but don't have to interact with them... but the food was great.  I got the Pad Thai and the Chicken Satay.  The Chicken Satay was especially great and I will definitely be at Busaba Eathai again!

UYy_3wYWAd4fM1wqjxuZhg.text: Busaba can do no wrong in my eyes. i adore absolutely everything about this restaurant (soho, shepherd's bush westfield) and it is generally my go to restaurant for a refuel after a bout of intense shopping at either Selfridges or Westfield. as soon as i enter, the ambience and fantastic customer service make all my worries over the demise of my credit card faaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaade away :-) everything about it warrants five stars. they make no claim to be any specific asian cuisine  but rather a fusion of all  and it works extremely well. it is all reasonably priced, appetising and filling. VERY good value for money. i find it absoluterly wonderful when you go to a restaurant and tip not because you feel obliged to, but because you WANT to. fabulous.

lPR1An6bL0Hw7xSzHZX64A.text: brilliant concept, cheap and sociable!i love the communal style of sitting around  a table with strangers, not only do you get to have a good look at other people's food - you know we all  do it so dont deny it!the salt n pepper squid is my fav! took some of my friends to the tottenham ct road one and one commented "its the best restaurant ive been to!"just do it!

o7hugunCoQre65QEV_2zeA.text: all i can say is this place ROCKS! great atmosphere, lovely food - u have to order the calamari! and a touch of romantic too!! if you want less of a queue dont go to the wardour street one stick to the one behind Selfridges!

wv6U3pk5CFxFqAgDG0ecdA.text: Great food and wonderful ambiance.  A definite stop while visiting  London.

jIZeMb54Swf26YlSEefzJw.text: I was going to Ten Ten Tei in Soho however I'd had a few beers and my friend was worried I might be a bit loud for such a small restaurant. So we went to Busaba on his recommendation. I'll keep this short, the calamari was genuinely amazing, I've never tasted anything as good. However the Duck was literally (I can't emphasise this enough) like eating a shoe. It was tough and honestly tasted like a cross between leather and a welly. It was too noisy for me and I dislike sharing tables but this is only a personal thing. Service was fairly good, however it was difficult to get someones attention for the bill. I tried the pad thai my friend was eating and that was also very good so I maybe just chose badly with the duck.

saRSID0QCp8AFV5DKKTPRw.text: Before heading to London this past January, I did my culinary recon via intense online researching and through friends and family of mine who reside in and around London. On more then one occasion did this restaurant come up, so I had to make it a point to stop in.   Busaba Eathai has three locations in London, the one I hit up was the location off Wardour Street a 10 minute walk from Oxford Circus. I can honestly say that this restaurant boasts some of the best Thai food I have ever consumed. Approaching the restaurant on a Saturday night, the side street it's located on is rather calm. I was definitely surprised to walk in and find the restaurant buzzing with locals and tourists alike. The décor is a deep wood theme which carries through the walls, tables, and even chopsticks. Definitely one of the sleeker Thai restaurants I have been in. Having binged out at Borough Market all day, my companions and I were not deathly starving, so we decided to skip out on salads and soups and head straight for the mains. We did however order one app which the waitress recommended to us. The side was called Pandan chicken, it consisted of chicken with garlic and coriander root, wrapped in a pandan leaf. Great presentation on this dish and the flavours of garlic, coriander, and pandan were sealed into the chicken via the neatly wrapped leaf.  For mains, we ordered the Pad Thai Jay - rice noodle with shitake, tofu, baby corn, french bean, peanut, bean sprout, and lime. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the assortment of vegetables created a successful medley of flavours, great vegetarian dish. Next on the list was crab meat egg fried rice with spring onion, the rice was moist and screaming flavour, the crab meat, egg and onions formed a deadly threesome. Last was the cream of the crop, the lamb red curry with lychee and cherry tomato. This was definitely one of the best Thai curry dishes I have ever had. The red curry was so sweet, and the lamb was falling apart. The lychee really rounded out the flavour for me and after we finished eating the dish and licking the bowl dry, I could have ordered it again.    I will warn you that Basuba is known for its long queues and busy atmosphere due to the restaurant being so popular. Many of the tables are square seating up to 10 ppl, so you may very well find yourself eating besides complete strangers, to me this is no problem but some may find this offsetting. As far as pricing goes, I don't believe there are any dishes over $10. Typically in London prices for quality foreign food is extravagant, but Busaba's is very reasonably priced making this a more affordable venue to eat at. I can not vouch that you will find fully traditional authentic Thai dishes here, but you will find many of them with chic modern twists that work. Why do they work so well? ALAN YAU directs the restaurant, he is a highly successful restauranteur who's restaurants have attained Michelin starts, and his Dim Sum restaurant Hakkasan in the Soho district took the 18th spot in the magazine Restaurant's Top 50 restaurants (08'). Alan knows what works, trust me.

pCsV_UUHmP6RqvbuoxnsKg.text: I went to Busaba for the first time on Friday night, the queue came well out of the door, people lining the side of the building waiting patiently for a table. We were hungry but were prepared to wait, after five minutes a waiter came down the line looking for 2 people so we skipped the queue and were seated on a bench by the window.   A bit distracting with the waiting people looking down on us while we were eating but we soon got used to it.It's a busy restaurant, benches and large tables with no booking option, fast service, fast turnaround and cheap for what you get.  We had a bottle of delicious Pinot Grigio, chargrilled sword fish and Thai Calamari with ginger and peppercorn.  Amazing food, definitely worth queuing and putting up with the unsmiling waitresses.

g9VbBVrzpMrymijjQvoiow.text: My co-worker in London described this place as the McDonald's of Thai food.  I wasn't sure how to take that because I love Sausage McMuffins and they have the best fries.  Everything else in between is eh.  Even with that we ventured forwarded with the assumption that this wasn't the most authentic of Thai joints.  We passed by this place the other day and it was crowded, long lines out the door.  I'm not sure how I feel about community tables.  The amount of Siracha I use should allow me not to have to share it with some wanker across the table who isn't putting the bottle back into the middle.  The menu was pretty limited and definitely lacked some of the dishes I've come to enjoy like chinese brocoli with crispy pork, mee krob and some of the soups.  Anyway we ordered an obscene amount of food as usual.  The best dishes were pad see ew, chicken satay (thick pieces not on skewers) and the crab fried rice.  The fried rice was easily one of the best fried rice dishes I've had outside of DTF.  The pad see ew was mixed with lots of different types of seafood and pretty good but they had the wrong type of noodles.  Pad see ew noodles are usually the thick flat rice noodles but this version used noodles you'd more commonly find in ramen.  Big error.  When the chicken satay is one of the best dishes of the night (ordered 8 total) then something is amiss.  One of my work friends isn't as adventurous and wanted to pick a safety dish alongside the noodle and rice dishes which I know he loves.  The spicy prawns and jungle curry were mediocre at best.  The curry was spicy but a bit oily and something about the flavor was off.  The papaya salad lacked punch and flavors.  A lot of people from the US on the board should come out to LA so I can take them to some bomb ass authentic Thai in Hollywood.  I have some stuff that will knock your socks off.

GbFzDC1PMve4Vp5xsHnZPw.text: Love this place. The food is really fresh tasting creative and affordable. Not your standard thai this place is a bit of a scene.  Definitely not a relaxing meal as these tables turn over quick.

d2R2Uz-AhMs0cDqje7HmqQ.text: Don't be put out by the queue outside, the short wait is really worth it! Busaba delivers amazing thaï food for a small price in a convivial and busy environment.Staff is always very attentive and nice and sharing your table makes the experience relaxed and unfussy. From the rich Muslim curry to the spicy basil prawns or the green curry fried rice with chargrilled chicken, every dish I've ever tasted has delivered on great flavours. I even love the ginger and peppercorn calamaris even though I don't really like them normally.The only small downfall is on the wine selection as I find it a bit reductive and not always tasty.Otherwise, this is definitely THE place to share a meal before going out in the West End!

uyi2z05NZnXROXKOnn4EOg.text: ok yes this place is good and very popular.  but i think people hype it up way more than it needs.  i enjoyed my curry and it was decently priced for a nice restaurant.  i like how they have really large tables.my only beef is that the service wasn't that great when i went.  when you serve spicy food you should probably give more than a toddler size cup of water..and when someone needs more..they shouldn't have to ask 3 times.but yeah overall meal was good.  i just relaly don't like when people don't give me water.

1xZWI4lvSQrydxqB7NG6Ag.text: Best Thai in London. Best flavours, very authentic. Can get noisy in evenings but come for the food and busy atmosphere. One of my absolute favorites.

irohPguQAij3tQ6oMoaujg.text: Very sociable set up, queues are long because it's popular but move so quickly, efficient service, delicious food, a great fallback for those visits to Soho when you realise that none of you feel like Chinese.

1M6iGF6jWAxrw0Gz8EMU9g.text: I have to write a review of my favorite restaurant in London! I just went there last night and as always came out feeling happy and waiting for my next visit. If you go please order the amazing Thai squid, I swear by them. Also the duck curry is so delectable and full of flavor and it goes perfectly well with the coconut rice. If you go with a big group you might wait a while for your table so be aware of that. But be patient its worth it. The price for your dinner will be so incredibly cheap for the quality of food you'll be skipping down Wordour Street like I did last night.

DRL9B609Fc4Tvdfn_HUdBw.text: I love Busaba but only wish one of the branches allowed for more intimate dinning. Communal dinning is okay but it would be nice to have the option.

hKEmmc7MA7_1RAjSKYqyFA.text: busaba is just one of alan yau's many geniuses. this man knows how to fill in the gaps. whether it is from catering high end meals to satiating cheap and cheerful meals for us more po' folk, he gets the stomach happy. i think busaba is a great concept of a restaurant. very eastern in its seating as you share a table with a bunch of strangers, which some find off-putting and others rather enjoyable for random conversation. the prices are affordable, the food yummy. try the chili prawn stir fry, coconut  rice, thai calamari, and chinese broccoli. none of these should disappoint. just be careful on thur, fri, and sat nites as you should expect a long wait.

mKsSW4-bnOgz3z_rGeFhfQ.text: My friend and I had dinner at Busaba Eathai, and the place was packed. That was a good sign that the food was good. We ordered the grilled aubergine salad, prawn pad thai, monk fish curry, and chicken satay to share, and we left no plate unturned. Because the place is so popular and the way the space was designed (informal seating), we found ourselves yelling in order to be able to hear each other. After filling our stomachs, we wanted to sit and chat for a bit more, but I think the waiter was trying to shoo us (a dinner line was forming outside, and getting longer by the minute). I think this only becomes an issue during peak hours like lunch and dinner, though. However, despite all this, the food was excellent, and my friend and I both left the restaurant satisfied and pleased.

4e-tY61grgbI6mB5-8-Eiw.text: Busaba is a rare London find: sleek, minimal decor, communal tables, swift service and great food. Oh and did I mention it's very reasonably priced? Servings aren't huge, but the quality is outstanding - Busaba boasts the best calamari in town.Their "no booking" policy means there are usually queues on Fridays and Saturdays, and staff are sometimes a bit frantic, but believe me, it's worth it. Oh, and it boasts one of the most fabulous bathroom sinks in London.
